STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 30, 2025
Hope Elizabeth Mulder James
SAMARITAS - SOUTHWEST
4341 S WESTNEDGE AVE STE 2000, Suite 2000
KALAMAZOO, MI, 49008-3284
Re: License #: CB390258392
Dear Hope Elizabeth Mulder James:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
4/29/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (4) An agency shall document placement
specifications consistent with the information
contained in the reevaluation. The placement
specifications must include all the following:
• (a) The age, number, SOGIE, race, ethnic
background, and characteristics of children
preferred by the applicants.
Three of Three open foster home files reviewed contained reevaluation reports that
lacked placement specifications including SOGIE preferences/recommendation.
CPA Rule 400.12325 License recommendation
• (3) Except for an original license, an agency shall
recommend to the department the issuance of a
regular license or the continuation of an active
license only when all rules are in compliance, or
both of the following conditions exist:
• (b) A written corrective action plan has
been developed. The plan must comply
with all of the following requirements:
2

• (i) Upon determining a rule
noncompliance that is correctable by
the foster parent, the agency must
develop a written corrective action
plan with the foster parent on the
form prescribed by the department.
Three of Three open foster home files reviewed contained a reevaluation
documenting the home was not in compliance with the foster home rule requirement
regarding water temperature; however, no corrective action plan was developed.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:
• (f) A dental re-examination must be
obtained at least every 9 months, unless a
greater frequency is indicated.
One of Eight open files of youths in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation of a periodic dental examination being completed timely.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:
• (d) Current immunizations for each child as
required by section 5111 of the public
health code, 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.5111.
All the following apply:
• (i) A statement from a parent or
licensed medical authority, which
indicates that immunizations are
current or contraindicated, is
sufficient documentation of
immunizations.
One of Eight open files of youths in foster care placements reviewed contained
documentation of the youth being overdue for one immunization.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
3

• (2) For an emergency placement, if any of the
information specified in subrule (1)(a) to (h) of this
rule is not available at the time of placement, then
the agency shall provide information to the foster
parent within 7 calendar days of the placement.
One of Eight open files of youths in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation of all required information being provided to the youth's caregiver
within 7 calendar days of the emergency placement.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (6) Service plans must be signed by the social
services worker and the social services
supervisor.
Seven of Eleven open files of youths in out of home care (8 foster care & 3 IL)
contained service plans/PATPs that were missing worker and/or supervisor
signatures.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2024C0001101SI report date 5/3/2024, CAP approved 6/5/2024
Renewal 4/26/2024, CAP Approved 5/14/2024
Interim 4/26/2023, CAP Approved 5/11/2023
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
• (a) Within 30 calendar days from removal
from the home.
Two of Eleven open files of youths in out of home care (8 foster care & 3 IL)
contained initial service plans that were not completed timely.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial
removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
4

Two of Eleven open files of youths in out of home care (8 foster care & 3 IL)
contained updated service plans that were not completed timely.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal 4/26/2024, CAP Approved 5/14/2024
Interim 4/26/2023, CAP Approved 5/11/2023
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
Two of Eight open files of youths in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation of the PATP being provided to and discussed with the caregivers
and/or parents.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED previously cited as FOM 722-08D
Renewal 4/26/2024, CAP Approved 5/14/2024
Interim 4/26/2023, CAP Approved 5/11/2023
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
• (2) An agency social service worker shall visit the
foster child, and the foster parent, if applicable, in
the child's placement at least once every month.
Two of Eight open files of youths in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation that all face-to-face visits with the youths and caregivers took place
in the youth's placement, as required.
5

REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED previously cited as FOM 722-06H
2024SIC0001530 report date 7/25/2024, CAP approved 8/29/2024
Renewal 4/26/2024, CAP Approved 5/14/2024
Interim 4/26/2023, CAP Approved 5/11/2023
CPA Rule 400.12502 Program statement
• (2) An agency shall give a copy of the program
statement to a youth before placement in
independent living.
One of Three open files of youths living independently reviewed did not contain
documentation the youth was provided the agency's independent living program's
program statement prior to the youth's placement in the program.
CPA Rule 400.12503 Policy and procedures
• (3) An agency shall provide a youth in
independent living with a copy of the agency's
policies and procedures required by this rule.
One of Three open files of youths living independently reviewed did not contain
documentation the youth was provided the agency's independent living program's
policies and procedures prior to the youth's placement in the program.
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
• (2) The agreement must be signed and dated by
the youth and the social service worker. The
agreement must be reviewed with the youth at
least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
One of Three open files of youths living independently reviewed did not contain
documentation the youth was provided and signed an updated independent living
agreement every 90 days.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• All borrowed bed paperwork must be uploaded prior to/at placement for
placements occurring after CWLM implementation.
• Case contacts must be entered in case records and reviewed for within service
plans to ensure proper documentation. Utilizing alternative documentation
6

methods such as home visit forms must also accompany an applicable social
work contact entry.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Face to Face contacts documented in MiSACWIS must include enough
information to determine who was present, where the visit took place, and what
occurred. A contact simply stating a visit took place in the home does not meet
the quality visit standards and should be address during service plan review.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no substantiated incidents of corporol punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted three CAPs during the period under review, as follows:
The first was in response to the 2024 licensing inspection report dated 4/19/2024,
CAP Approved 5/14/2025. The CAP addressed 10 violations, 3 of which were
policy violations no longer regulated by DCWL. Of the remaining 7 violations, three
were not resolved by the CAP as they were cited this year.
The second was in response to special investigation 2024C0001101SI report date
5/3/2024, CAP approved 6/5/202. The CAP addressed a violation of CPA rule
400.12418(5) for one foster care worker not having involved caregivers in the
development of service plans. That CAP was not successful as the violation was
repeated this year.
The third was in response to special investigation 2024SIC0001530 report date
7/25/2024, CAP approved 8/29/2024. The CAP addressed a violation of CPA rule
400.12421(2) for one foster care worker not having visited nine youths in May of
2024. This violation was repeated during this inspection and will require additional
corrective action planning.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed on 4/14/2025. The chief
administrator indicated there has been an immense amount of change in staffing
and leadership since the last inspection, including director, program manager,
supervisors, and direct care staff. The change in staffing has, at times, led to poor
case transition and a lack of compliance with the CAP that resulted from last
year's inspection. Some areas in which compliance has been noted to have been
improved include sibling and worker/parent visits. The chief administrator identified
7

three unplanned placement breaks that potentially could have been prevented by
better communication and follow-through by workers related to caregiver
needs/requests.
Financial Overview
The agency's financial statements and independent auditor's report dated June
19, 2024, were reviewed. No financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
The staff interviewed discussed the changes in the leadership and direct care
team during the past year. They expressed challenges with taking over cases/staff
from others who were not providing consistent support and direction. They also
discussed the positive direction in which they feel the agency is heading.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space and equipment to provide the delivery of foster
care, independent living, and certification services. Physical CHRI is stored
securely in a locked file cabinet within the same office as a cross shredder. All
other files are stored securely in a lockable file storage room.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
April 29, 2025
________________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
April 30, 2025
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
